subject: Mental Health
title: Persistent Depressive Disorder
description: Learn Persistent Depressive Disorder in one minute.

hook.text: Imagine feeling low-grade depressed every single day for two years straight.

buildup.text: Persistent depressive disorder, or dysthymia, is a chronic, milder form of depression.

discovery.text: It saps energy and motivation without the dramatic crashes of major depression.

twist.text: Many people don't realize they have it â€” they think this is just who they are.

climax.text: When major depression hits on top of dysthymia, clinicians call it double depression.

punchline.text: The low hum becomes so normal you forget it's there.

quiz.question: How long must symptoms last to diagnose persistent depressive disorder?
